channel.title: Texera on Apache Texera
channel.description: Recent content in Texera on Apache Texera

item.title: Single Node Installation
item.description:
This document describes how to set up and run Texera on a single machine using Docker Compose.

Prerequisites

Before starting, make sure your computer meets the following requirements:

Resource Type Minimum Recommended
CPU Cores 2 8
Memory 4GB 16GB
Disk Space 20GB 50GB

You also need to install and launch Docker Desktop on your computer. Choose the right installation link for your computer:

Operating System Installation Link
macOS Docker Desktop for Mac
Windows Docker Desktop for Windows
Linux Docker Desktop for Linux

After installing and launching Docker Desktop, verify that Docker and Docker Compose are available by running the following commands from the command line:

item.title: Access/Login to Texera
item.description:
Guide to use Texera on your local machine or development environment.

Prerequisites

We assume you either went through

  • Single Node Instruction, or
  • Guide for Texera Developers.

Texera should be up-and-running on your laptop before proceeding.

Note

Ensure Docker and Docker Compose are installed before building Texera.

Access Texera through Browser

Enter Texera’s URL in your browser to access the interface.

By default, an admin account is pre-created:

item.title: Texera UI Overview
item.description:
Understand the layout and functionality of Texeraâ€™s User Dashboard.

User Dashboard

Once logged in, you should see the following page:

Navigation Bar

On the left sidebar, you can switch between different resource modules:

  • Workflows â€” manage workflow projects.
  • Datasets â€” upload and manage data files.
  • Quota â€” check usage statistics and resource consumption.
  • Admin â€” manage system users (visible only to admins).

Tip

Hover over the navigation icons to see quick tooltips for each section.

item.title: Contribution Guidelines
item.description:
Thank you for your interest in contributing to Texera! This guide explains how to contribute to both Texeraâ€™s codebase and documentation.
We follow a fork-based workflow and adopt the Conventional Commits standard for commit messages.

Contributing to Texera

Texera welcomes contributions from everyone â€” whether youâ€™re fixing a small bug, improving documentation, or adding new features.

ðŸ‘¥ Roles in the Project

Role Key Permissions How to Join
Contributor Submit issues & PRs, join discussions Start contributing â€” no formal process
Committer Merge PRs, push code, vote on code changes Nominated by PPMC based on quality contributions
PPMC Member Governance, release voting, new committer approvals Voted by existing PPMC members
Mentor Guide project and ensure Apache compliance Appointed by the Incubator PMC

ðŸ›  How to Contribute Code

1. Fork the Repository

Fork the Texera repository on GitHub and clone it locally.
